attributes.action: Scrap the Severn bridge tolls sooner than December 2018.
attributes.background: The Severn bridge tolls are due to be scrapped in December 2018, with a reduction in January 2018. The bridge has paid for itself several times over but the UK government refuse to abolish the tolls sooner, this is having a detrimental effect on the welsh economy, welsh business and commuters.

attributes.action: Bring back vehicle tax discs
attributes.background: The number of unlicensed vehicles on the road has tripled since the paper tax disc was abolished. Government figures point to lost revenue of £107m from 755,000 unlicensed vehicles last year. Scrapping the tax disc was meant to save £10m a year, but it failed. The government needs to do a u-turn.
attributes.additional_details: See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-42009111 for more background

attributes.action: Make Financial Studies a core subject on the National Curriculum at Key Stage 4
attributes.background: Sometimes we all question some of the things we had to learn at school, like pi or algebra, and how they have had no relevance in our lives at all. Some of us may have achieved an A* in our English Literature exam, but Shakespeare will never help you understand how to get a mortgage or manage debt.
attributes.additional_details: Debt and money issues are a rising concern for young people in the UK, with those aged 16 to 24 having the highest individual debt to income ratio amongst all over age groups (Household debt inequalities dataset, ONS, April 2016). School should be preparing our children for the real world, and I call on the UK Government to make financial studies a core subject in our National Curriculum, so that our children can leave school with the best chances of being financially stable and debt free.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of dogs in pet shops and introduce stricter licensing requirements.
attributes.background: Puppy farms breed masses of dogs for profit with little regard for their welfare. Many dogs in pet shops come from these puppy farms, so by banning their sale it will help drive them out of business.
attributes.additional_details: The legal limit of litters per bitch should also be lowered from six to four, to protect the health of the mother. It should be mandatory for the buyer of a puppy to first see the dog at home with its mother. This should crack down on the reselling of dogs through a third party.

attributes.action: Stop hospitals from charging blue badge holders parking in hospitals
attributes.background: As if people with disabilities don't have enough to worry about without some hospitals now charging them to park. People on disability are an easy target and often have to visit hospitals frequently through no fault of their own and to start charging them to park is a disgrace.
attributes.additional_details: We need to put an end to this and support the disabled not punish them for their disability. This can only be seen as greed and it needs to be sorted out now.

attributes.action: Abolish the annual Rod Licence for anglers in England and Wales
attributes.background: More than a million freshwater anglers in England and Wales (not Scotland) pay an annual fee for a (fishing) Rod Licence. This is a tax on angling. Yet there is no licence needed to walk the same river, nor to visit our National Parks, nor to climb a mountain or bicycle on our roads.
attributes.additional_details: Income from licences is falling. Between 2010 and 2016 a drop of 12.6%. Income down from £25.4m to £22.2m. Dr. Broughton at the ATA has collated data over the last six years. •You don't need a licence in Scotland or for sea fishing. •It is unfair anglers have to buy a licence to enjoy a legal hobby when no others who make an equal claim on natural resources do •Anglers spend £1.2bn annually; that is £240m in VAT income alone. Abolition is likely to see participation increase

attributes.action: Increase the student loan repayment threshold for all graduates (Type 1 Loan)
attributes.background: Type 2 (Post sep 2012 students) student loans have recently had a threshold increase to £25000. Now pre Sep 2012 starters pay 9% contributions on every single penny above £17,775. If a grad from 2014 and 15 both earned 25k. Then the grad from 2014 would earn (Gross) £650.25 less than the 2015 grad.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be the difference between being approved for a mortgage or refused. 

Considering only the top 23% of graduates pay their loans back within 30 years. We want the government to help all graduates and make the threshold for all student loans the same. 

It could be suggested its just another kick in the teeth for millennials who were born a decade late for affordable housing. 

https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/family/2017/10/victory-for-graduates-student-loan-repayment-threshold

attributes.action: Make promoting Paedophilia a criminal offence
attributes.background:
It's time for the UK Parliament to better protect and deliver justice for our children by proving to the British People that they believe Paedophilia to be abhorrent. 
Paedophilia has been promoted by speakers at a conference held at the University of Cambridge in 2013.

attributes.action: Make more council houses and flats
attributes.background: There are to many family's and single people suffering about not having homes we need to make sure that nobody should be homeless in this day and age families or people should feel safe
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken to people living on the streets also have seen to many programmes on this subject the government needs to take action

attributes.action: Stop councils charging for DIY waste at recycling sites.
attributes.background: The relevant government department has stated that these charges should not be imposed. Any discouragement to the proper disposal of DIY waste will contribute to the increase in fly tipping.

attributes.action: Amend building regulations to ban use of wooden/ laminate flooring in flats.
attributes.background:
Wooden and laminate floors in non-ground floor flats can make life very difficult for people living in flats below. The noise can be unbearable. 

Building regulations should be amended to ban the use of such flooring in non-ground floor flats.

attributes.action: Stop all serving politicians from being included in any Honours lists
attributes.background: Time and time again who ever is in government are seen to be rewarding loyal members of their party even if they aren't doing a good job. Being Knighted for sitting on a committee or being a loyal party member isn't good enough and is making a joke of the whole system.

attributes.action: Provide increase support for parents with disabilities and their children
attributes.background: Children who have parents with disabilities are only able to access free school meals, the nursery grant for 2 year olds and pupil premium if they are on income related benefits. This means many working parents with a disabled partner are left better off leaving work to care for their families.
attributes.additional_details: Where a parent is on PIP they are considered “incapacitated” for childcare purposes in tax credit legislation and for extended hours nursery provision for 3 year olds. This does not extend to pupil premium, 2 year old nursery places or to free school meals - even if the incapacitated parent is unable to prepare a meal for themselves. Where one parent works and the other is considered incapacitated, children should receive these in order for the working parent to remain in work.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for drivers to hit and run when hitting a domestic animal
attributes.background: This point needs to be put into action because domesticated animals being killed with no justice is no option and should be a criminal offence. When an animal companion is removed it leaves people feeling very alone and broken, looking for justice that currently can’t be served - personal experience

attributes.action: To move Parliament to new buildings more suitable for 21st century Britain
attributes.background: To look at building a new Houses of Parliament, more suitable for a 21st century Britain, that shows clearly, MPs are public servants, elected by the people, to serve the people. The current premises are alien to a modern, successful country
attributes.additional_details: The current Houses of Parliament will make a fantastic British historic building to open up for the public, will pay for itself in visitors and events.

attributes.action: Specialised glasses for the colour-blind on the NHS
attributes.background:
Imagine opening you eyes every morning and everything is browns yellows and dark blues.
Imagine growing up realising there's a whole new world of colours, yet your unable to see what others see. Reds, pinks, purples, oranges, light blues are some of the basic colours that a victim of Deuteranopia
attributes.additional_details:
My aim in this petitions is to try and fight to get glasses for the colour-blind available on the NHS. Why? 
•Children experiencing difficulty at school if colours are used to help with learning 
•Problems with food, such as identifying whether meat is fully cooked or whether fruit is ripe 
•Getting medications confused 
•Trouble identifying safety warnings or signs 
•Slightly limited career choices – certain jobs, such as pilots, train drivers and electricians

attributes.action: Legislate to ban fast food delivery riders from working without a full license.
attributes.background: Fast food delivery riders are under pressure to deliver as soon as possible, in some cases they have a set time, or lose money.  They can get on a moped with no training or experience.  All that is required is a provisional licence and a set of ‘l plates’.
attributes.additional_details: Riders can be seen throughout the UK weaving  and zigzagging through traffic, overtaking and squeezing through almost impossible spaces, in a kamikaze like attempt to deliver and get back to base and be on the road again. This gets worse when other delivery riders are near.  Intense rivalry between companies and even colleagues makes for dangerous situations.

attributes.action: Only allow fireworks on Firework night and New Years Eve due to pets rights.
attributes.background: I believe it is wrong that fireworks are released for days before and days after both Fireworks night and New Years Eve. This can scare pets and cause them to be unable to move from a position or relieve themselves outside. This is against their rights under the five freedoms, so should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: This can also cause animals to run away from owners, or bolt when on walks, and so can leave owners devastated, and can lead to deaths and injuries to these animals. This can cause both emotional, physical and financial damage to the owners and public, along with emotional and physical damage to pets.

attributes.action: Put Dropped Kerbs REQUIRED in Law into the Highways Acts, At this time it is Not
attributes.background: A number today just do their own thing on the Highways causing Areas to look Run Down, All Properties that want a Drive ‘Must Have A Dropped Kerb’ and a Tarmac Area to their Boundary, this would keep things in Order and Controlled, some put items in the gutter to get over it, Dangerous to Cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
Some Property Owners Churn Up the Grass Verges causing issues with Mud Displacement onto Footpaths which the Council has to Clean Up st Cost, if it was Law to have a Dropped Kerb none of these issues would arise, believe anyone doing so can Get Blocked in as there is No drive in Law, if Written into the Highways Acts would clean up the Highways in General, also stop these putting things into the gutters to get over the Kerbs and keep them free from any Obstruction.

Should be common sense.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to have sprinklers in all schools in the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Childrens lives are being put at risk because new schools or refurbished school since 2014 do not have to have sprinklers fitted
In Scotland and Wales it is mandatory so it should be the same for English and Northern Irish schools
attributes.additional_details:
The National Fire Chiefs Council believe all schools should be fitted as seen in this BBC article dated 25 October 2017
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-41744582
The DfE's "expectation that all new schools will have sprinklers fitted", unless a school is "low risk" and installation "would not be good value for money".
Despite this, less than a third of the 260 schools built since 2014 under the Schools Building Programme have sprinklers

attributes.action: Make Northumberland Scottish land
attributes.background: I think that Scotland should rightfully own Northumberland. This is because Northumberland and Scotland share a similar culture and have strong ethnic ties. I believe this may help with the economy and natural resources as Northumberland has a lot of coal.
attributes.additional_details: Back in 2014/2015 many petitions were made for Northumberland to once again join Scotland. Many news articles reported on this. However, the people who signed those petitions did not get their wish. We have a shared history and culture. The UK Government in London doesn't govern Northumberland very well.

attributes.action: Make gender neutral uniforms compulsory in UK schools
attributes.background: Across the UK, children are unnecessarily, and directly discriminated against in schools, simply because of their gender. Despite various acts of parliament, schools in the UK are still able to dictate what a child of a certain gender can wear. This is most unfitting in 21st century Britain.
attributes.additional_details: However, British schools are prescribed to teach British values. Most notably, individual liberty, and mutual respect. Yet, such values are compromised if, for example, boys cannot wear skirts, or girls are unable to wear trousers. Not least, in some uniform policies boys cannot wear earrings, or possess long hair, whereas girls at the same institution can. Such uniforms also put those children who do not identify as either a boy, or a girl at risk. Attitudes towards gender need to change.

attributes.action: Include the Welsh dragon onto the Union Jack.
attributes.background: For centuries Wales has been brutally ignored from our nation's flag. We with a voice must feel empowered to speak up against this disgrace. In November 2007 the House of Commons discussed this however no follow up action has been executed. We must take action and be proud of our heritage!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-25222891 Here is a fantastic list of examples of how the UK should represent the beautiful country of Wales. 
IMG_7543.JPG

attributes.action: Introduce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: The Saudi state is notorious for its unjust and frankly disgusting treatment of women and LGBT people. It also massively restricts the civil liberties of its entire population. There is also evidence that suggests Saudi donors sponsor terrorism. We cannot support governments of this sort.
attributes.additional_details:
From gov.uk: 
"It’s illegal for women to drive."
"Homosexual acts and extra-marital sexual relations, including adultery, are illegal and can be subject to severe penalties."
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge"

A series of leaks from the then-Secretary of State Hillary Clinton's emails suggested that Saudi donors fund extremism.
A number of mosques found to be preaching extremist Wahhabism have been said to be linked to Saudi organisations.

attributes.action: Abolish driver cpc, it's not improving driver standards, it's causing a shortage
attributes.background: The Driver cpc was brought in to educate and raise standards of professional drivers, this has had no affect, as a driver I see the standards are the same. Drivers learn their skill set in accordance to their jobs. Forcing drivers to pay thousands in useless training, causing a huge driver shortage

attributes.action: To make it law that all public places to have a defibrillator on site
attributes.background: On the 23rd a December I was at a non league football match, a spectator suffered a cardiac arrest. The club had a defibrillator on site and that saved the mans life.
attributes.additional_details: I was going make the petition about non league football grounds having a defibrillator, I have decided to make it all public places. For example every supermarket , football ground and shopping centre must have a defibrillator.

attributes.action: Make Alzheimer’s/Dementia care completely funded by the NHS.
attributes.background:
Full funding for the care of Alzheimer’s and Dementia patients should be covered by the NHS. Plenty of families face so many worries when a loved one goes into care and paying for their care shouldn’t be one of them. 
Please take a moment to sign my petition.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Ensure HMI inspectors inspecting SEN schools have sufficient experience in SEN
attributes.background: From both personal experience and talks with others educational professionals, the majority of OFSTED inspectors who grade special schools have insufficient knowledge of SEN or more shockingly, none.

attributes.action: Make Puppy farming a criminal offence
attributes.background: A puppy farmer is a breeder who breeds puppies with little or no regard for the health and welfare of the puppies or their parents. Once the puppies are born, they are separated from their mothers at 4 weeks old. After, the bitches are given dangerous injections for them to go back into heat
attributes.additional_details:
Health of puppies sold by puppy farmers:
20% of puppies (four times more than the average) bought from pet shops or directly from the internet suffer from parvovirus, an often fatal disease which can cost up to £4,000 to treat (2014 Kennel Club PAW survey).

With no regulations, puppy mills have no cleanup control. This means that dogs can be living in urine and feces for indefinite periods of time.

Puppy mills have no veterinary care, climate control, or protection for the animals from weather

attributes.action: Reverse the government plans to remove women's refuges from the welfare system.
attributes.background: Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid, said: “The government’s proposed reforms to supported housing will dismantle our national network of lifesaving refuges and put the lives of women and children trying to escape domestic abuse at risk. This is a matter of life or death.”
attributes.additional_details:
Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid told the Guardian

 “If pursued, the reforms will result in a postcode lottery of domestic abuse support services, with ... refuges being forced to close their doors and more women and children being turned away from the lifesaving support they offer,” she said.

The reforms fly in the face of pledges made by the prime minister to make it a key personal priority to transform the way the UK tackles domestic violence.

attributes.action: Lower Import duty on classic car parts from the USA.
attributes.background: Many small car/garage businesses in the UK rely on classic car parts and associated services from the USA but many struggle financially  due to the amount of duty paid. We ask Parliament to either abolish it on classic car parts or lower it to a reasonable level, with clear rules on its application
attributes.additional_details: There have been numberous instances where we have sent car parts for engineering work in the USA having already imported it from the USA only to be charged import duty again on the parts return to the UK. The rules are evidently either unfair or unclear to those applying them. Your urgent attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated.

attributes.action: Make sure that development of new drugs is not adversely affected by BREXIT.
attributes.background: The Government must commit to following the current process for all drugs already in the EU clinical trial and approval pipeline.
attributes.additional_details:
Doctors and drug companies work in many countries to develop a drug.  Drugs in development now will be in Clinical Trial both before and after March 2019.

Bodies like the European Medicines Agency regulate drug approval with a single set of regulations and approval steps. 

Developing effective treatments for debilitating diseases will greatly reduce the long-term financial and social cost to the UK.

https://www.ft.com/content/e3e9ac6a-5f2d-11e7-8814-0ac7eb84e5f1

attributes.action: Make dog and cat runs planning permission exempt
attributes.background: Dog and cat runs are a grey area in the planning regulations as they are not a fixed structure, removable, and can not be considered a livable so do not come under planning rules but are also a fence and attached to or next to the house which some councils consider requiring planning permission.
attributes.additional_details: In relation to this, a conservatory, which is a livable space, a fixed structure, non removable, and increases the value of the property, does not require planning permission. This petition asks that the rules be amended to allow safe protection for our loved pets by allowing dog and cat runs extending no further that 4/5 meters from the rear wall of the original house the same as conservatories are 3/4 meters depending if the house is attached or detached.

attributes.action: Ban the use of lead in all shotgun cartridges
attributes.background: The lead in shotgun cartridges is poisoning our environment. This leads to the slow death of many species of birds. Albeit shot birds that are consumed by predatory birds and scavengers or birds ingesting them mistakenly taken as grit. There are many alternatives available to use.

attributes.action: Remove stamp duty for First Time Buyers by making sellers pay the tax
attributes.background:
Stamp Duty is a prohibitive tax to home ownership. 
First time buyers need help and will struggle to find the deposit as the UK is suffering a massive shortfall in homes. 
Most sellers have large  equity gains & removing the need for them to pay on their purchase, will allow the cost to be offset
attributes.additional_details:
By allowing this change, the whole market will benefit from movement as chains are completed by those hitherto unable to make the duty plus deposit.

Those downsizing and coming out of the market would have to pay more but they sit on the largest profits anyway  

First-time buyers in the UK could save an average of £3,625, while Londoners could save £13,171, if the tax burden was shifted to sellers.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-39139128

attributes.action: Save the UK FM Radio Signal
attributes.background:
In the next few years the UK’s analogue radio signal will be switched off and listeners will have to tune into digital radio instead.

The UK is NOT ready. FM sounds better and has better signal. DAB sounds tinny and car DAB signal drops out. 

PLEASE SAVE THE UK FM RADIO SIGNAL.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people will not be used to DAB systems and will already own FM capable technology and would struggle to make the change.

Older but perfectly usable stereo systems will become obsolete and people may not be able to afford new equipment.

The FM signal is a historic achievement and it works. Future generations will miss out on learning of radio frequencies.

A strong FM signal provides excellent sound quality for both music and speech, whereas DAB is significantly inferior.

attributes.action: Parents/carers of bullies should face jail time and/or a fine.
attributes.background: Children's suicide levels in the UK are on the rise and this is a direct result from being bullied. Bullying is a rampant problem in schools all across the UK, parents/carers need to take more responsibility for the actions of those in their care.
attributes.additional_details: In certain towns such as North Tonawand, New York have introduced laws where parents of bullies face a potential 15 days in prison or a $250 (£190) fine. The UK needs to follow suit in an attempt to resolve the ongoing problem that is bullying.

attributes.action: The history of Communism should be introduced into the GCSE history curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that communism is an important part of international history and will educate students of the united kingdom on the past and present.
attributes.additional_details: I have done a survey in my school which has shown that pupils have an interest in this subject and wish to learn more.

attributes.action: Remove MFL as a mandatory subject and allow students to chose if they take MFL
attributes.background: Plenty of students time is wasted learning a modern foreign language they have no interest in learning. Students should be allowed to pick if they take Modern Foreign Languages. Students should chose spend in a subject they have no interest in rather than wasting money and time of schools.

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: Encourage greater use of driverless trains by TOCs across the UK rail network.
attributes.background: TOCs' greatest cost is the wages of train drivers. Driverless trains have existed in the UK for decades, yet only a minority of the network use them. Driverless trains would increase efficiencies, make TOCs profitable, reduce the need for government subsidy, and enable a reduction in ticket prices.
attributes.additional_details:
- Automated de/acceleration patters help energy recovery and savings, making trains more environmentally friendly
- Drivers are no longer involved in monotonous tasks of driving a train. Some can be re-qualified and deployed along the line, providing more customer service and fewer staff-less stations
- Average speed of the system can increase
- 32 cities globally use fully automated metro systems
- Ticket prices and govt subsidies are unnecessarily high due to extortionate drivers wages

attributes.action: Make rail season tickets tax deductible for those on PAYE
attributes.background:
Presently individuals who pay tax via PAYE pay tax on the income earned to fund their rail season ticket.
 
It seems unjust that someone should have to pay taxation on income earned to fund a season ticked purchased for the purpose of commuting to work.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for Nurseries to charge on Bank Holidays or when closed.
attributes.background: I am a full time working parent, I have been since my daughter was 9 months old. I have paid in the region of £1300-950 a month for my child to attend full time nursery. Nurseries still have the right to charge full fees when closed or Bank holidays. Which means double fees or unpaid/annual leave.
attributes.additional_details: I understand it is so difficult for mums to take that leap back to work when childcare costs so much money!!! Unless you're unemployed or less hours you don't seem to be entitled to anything. Nurseries then have the right to charge for days the nursery is closed. Including Bank Holidays, training days & other. Some of us working parents that don't have family then have to pay out double fees or have to take annual or unpaid leave for this facility. It's another penalty that should not be allowed.

attributes.action: Ban Hate Groups, Britain First & English Defence League!
attributes.background: Under the Terrorism Act 2000, the Home Secretary may proscribe(ban) an organisation if (s)he believes it is concerned in terrorism, and it is proportionate to do. We call upon the Home Secretary to add Britain First and the EDL to the list of proscribed organisations.
attributes.additional_details:
This same terrorism act declares "acts of terrorism" as "acts of persons acting on behalf of, or in connection with, any organisation which carries out activities directed towards the overthrowing or influencing, by force or violence, of Her Majesty's government in the United Kingdom or any other government de jure or de facto."
We believe Britain First are advocates of racially motivated violence and this is well documented with violence at rallies and unfettered hate speech.
Britain does not tolerate this when it is religiously motivated, why should we tolerate it when it is founded on 'Nationalism'.

attributes.action: Call on DEFRA to withdraw UK approval of A24 trap, sold in NZ to kill hedgehogs.
attributes.background: DEFRA recently approved the use of these traps in England (pending in Wales & Scotland). The traps(https://www.goodnature.co.nz/pests/#c315) are sold to kill hedgehogs (& other species), in New Zealand where hedgehogs are non-native & considered a ‘pest’ species.
attributes.additional_details: In the UK hedgehogs are protected being listed on Schedule 6 of the Wildlife & Countryside Act. If a trap is set & it catches a hedgehog, then the person who set the trap can be prosecuted. Anyone setting traps for ‘vermin’ or non-protected species is obliged to take all reasonable precautions to avoid catching a protected species, since there are no ‘reasonable precautions’ to avoid catching hedgehogs using this trap, anyone who sets them is at risk of prosecution if they catch a hedgehog.

attributes.action: Include under 25s in the National Living Wage & adopt the real living wage.
attributes.background:
The Govt's National Living Wage is currently set at £7.50/hr for people aged 25 & over. However this doesn't apply to under 25s, some of whom can be on wages as low as £5.60/hr. We call on the Govt to:
- Include under 25s
- Adopt the real living wage (£10.20 in London, £8.75 in the rest of the UK)
attributes.additional_details: As the Living Wage Week comes to end, we believe that workers in Britain deserve a proper wage rise. With the Chancellor preparing to announce his first budget of this Parliament, we must put pressure on the Govt to adopt the real living wage released by the Living Wage Foundation. A report released by KPMG highlighted that 5.5 million people still earn less than the real Living Wage rates. If you believe that all workers deserve a fair day’s pay for a fair day’s work, please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Conjugal Visits Allowed In The UK To Stop Reoffending.
attributes.background: In the summer of 2014, The Howard League released a report entitled Sex in Prison. It explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe, Canada and even the Middle East. Dr Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper.
attributes.additional_details: The Howard League released a report where it explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe. Lorraine Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper who visited Halden prison in Norway in 2014, where conjugal visits are allowed. As a result, Norway has one of the lowest reoffending rates in the world, currently standing at 20%. In comparison, 59% of British prisoners reoffend within a year of being released.

attributes.action: reduce the brightness of vehicle emergency blue lights by half at night.
attributes.background: As a driver who works nights , I am regularly blinded by emergency vehicles using blue flashing lights. This causes a severe risk to other road users as my vehicle is a hgv that would cause mayhem if I lost control due to being blinded by these lights.

attributes.action: Allow under 40s to access their pension pot in order to buy their first house.
attributes.background: Young people are struggling to raise the funds to but their first home, yet they can have enough money for a deposit in their pension funds. The simplest solution being that younger people should be able to access their pension funds purely for use as a deposit for their first home.

attributes.action: Prevent purchasers withdrawing from domestic property sales without consequence.
attributes.background: In England purchasers having had an offer accepted by the vendor are at liberty to withdraw from the transaction right up until contracts are exchanged without any cause. When this happens the vendors are usually unable to complete their purchase and left with significant nugatory costs to bear.
